page.title: 08ST.MAWGAN VILLAGE STORE & PO
page.content: This is one of two shops in the centre of the village.It is over 400 years old and is a very attractive building.The present owners are Mr & Mrs Wharry.The main business is the sale of groceries,but meat,vegetables, toys,stationery and gifts are also sold.Part of the shop is the Post Office and about 100 Senior Citizens draw their pensions here each week.The shop opens at 8.45am and closes at 5.30pm-\ day is Sunday.The busiest time of day is from 3pm-3.30pm when parents meet their children from school.Approx.85% of the business is from local people and l5% from tourists.Behind the shop is a tearoom and garden which serves snacks and cream teas to about 30 people a day on average, during the Summer Months.
